review_title: Good place to work in rural community

job_title: Director of Special Projects in Vermillion, SD
pros: The environment is pretty flexible and most people at the lower levels get along with each other. Not a lot of micromanaging. Good leave benefits that people are encouraged to take.
cons: Communication from a leadership team in nonexistent including on basic things like annual cost of living increases or performance increases. Most of the time employees learn about new hires, people leaving, or important decisions from external partners before they're informed by leadership. Every time an employee leaves, leadership assumes current staff can simply absorb that work.

review_title: Excellent opportunities, incredibly poor management in the School of Health Sciences
pros: Great colleagues.  Great opportunities for state-wide grants to support research.
cons: Terrible management in the Dean’s Suite of the School of Health Sciences which includes Physical Therapy, Occupational Therapy, Social Work, Addiction Studies, Nursing, Physicians’ Assistant, Dental Hygiene and Masters of Public Health.    The dean of the School of Health Sciences is unbelievably bad.  She not only fails to support her faculty, she actively undermines them.  She is inconsistent and dishonest, fails to honor her commitments and does nothing to support or mentor faculty.

pros: The perks and benefits of the job were the best I’ve had the luxury to use.
cons: The constant backstabbing from other employees, higher ups, management is unrelenting and gives the Foundation a horrible reputation. They have had 48 people either quit or be fired in the last few years at a place that operates with only around  40 people all together. The culture made me question my own reasons for working there. I had a horrible boss who displayed zero empathy for anyone but those above. It’s a toxic work environment for someone looking for to gain experience.

review_title: Surprisingly low pay for a University
pros: State health and retirement benefits, all federal holidays off.  The town is small, and the University is centrally-located which makes commuting very easy. It is the largest employer in the county. State benefits include retirement, health, dental, and vision.  Typically get Christmas Eve and the day after Thanksgiving off, with pay, as well.
cons: Low wages comparatively.  There is a significant wage difference between job titles. Raises are very low and not guaranteed to happen every year.

pros: Being a state employee there are great benefits and lots of time off (holidays and vacation). There are plenty of opportunities for advancement. Co-workers are educated and easy to work with.
cons: There are lots of policies and procedures and at times can be bureaucratic. Also, like with any job, there are office politics to deal with.

pros:
*Pays well ~ $12/hour
*You get to learn new things while getting paid
*You get to work with senior software developers
*You get to meet professional computer scientist from all around the world.
cons:
*Terrible boss
*Terrible structural organization
*They want you to make the job above your classes!

job_title: Graduate Student-Research Assistant in Sioux Falls, SD
pros: Great support for research and encouraging entrepreneurial aspirations.  The University collaborates with South Dakota School of Mines and Technology with the Biomedical Engineering Program for a well balanced, comprehensive approach to their education.
cons: The financial compensation is not competitive with other larger universities which is understandable since the focus is shifted to the facilities and equipment.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Oak Ridge, TN
pros: This university is a good place to pursue high education with its multidisciplinary departments, the well balanced student-mentor ratios and good teaching and administrative staffs.
cons: This university locates at a small town that limits the balance of work and life. Also, the research activities may be hindered due to the limited resources.

review_title: USD treats their employees like disposable commodities.
job_title: Senior Building Maintenance Worker in Vermillion, SD
pros: USD is a reputable university with a good medical school. I worked with some good people that did their best despite the conditions.
cons: The university needs to realize that to keep a campus running efficiently they need to keep good people and pay them what they are worth. They do this by treating the staff like they are more than just peripherals to the faculty, that without them the university would fall apart, which it is.
